text: I come from a family of deep-sea divers
and I was the first generation that just
love cars my name is Gina Lucci and I am
the proprietor at the owner of a company
called picture cards East what we do is
we supply vehicles for the film industry
on the eastern seaboard we're located
right outside of Manhattan a location
which is called Red Hook Brooklyn we've
done movies like any cotton club and I
love those movies because we're
basically dealing with 30s with shitty
1933 to 1935 and the cause are just so
fantastic as you can see this is a 19-12
Model T actually one of four that we
prepared for a movie we modify them with
a late model engine and transmission and
we are red and basically you can drive
this car to California right now we pick
our paws with the director based on
characters a particular character would
drive this color car that type of car
and that's becomes very interesting you
know I just worked on a movie where they
needed the car to land on its side and
we took certain precautions on the car
so that the stuntman could flip the car
on its side and then we were able to
actually shoot inside the car with the
actors were in order to be in this
business I believe an individual needs
to love what he does it's very demanding
it's a 24-hour seven-day-a-week
type business you have to be available
the automobile is an integral part of
any film because it shows the period
that that you're shooting it gives
substance to the era but what's
happening is computers computers are
generating the image and they're getting
so good that they don't need the actual
physical automobile but I'm sure there's
going to be that one director who says
now I want to physically go out and
shoot it the old-fashioned way and
that's bad
